45:19 Caption: The game can't be described as attractive. We are hoping against hope that the second half will bring more exciting moments and goal opportunities. Neither team has really been able to control the flow of the game. The home side have dominated the possession and midfield so far. The visitors have spent most of their time defending and waiting for the right moment to launch counter-attacks.

46:27 Caption: What a beautiful moment! Stevan Jovetic (Sevilla) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way inside the right post. Keylor Navas just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 2:1.

48:11 Caption: Alejandro Hernandez is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
48:12 Caption: It was a good decision to watch today's encounter. There has been more to see on the pitch than in most of the other games. There wasn't any evident superiority by either side today. The home side's strategy was to maintain possession and put the opponent out of the game. While the visitors focused more on defence and catching their opponent on the break.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In a thrilling La Liga encounter at the Estadio Ramón Sánchez Pizjuán, Sevilla claimed a hard-fought 2-1 victory against Real Madrid, exhibiting a blend of resolute defending and clinical finishing. The home side’s triumph was characterized by spirited play, moments of high drama, and a rollercoaster of emotions for the fans.

### First Half:

From the very first whistle, it was evident that both teams were primed for an intense battle. Sevilla kicked off, quickly seizing control of the ball. However, the aggression manifested early as well, with Sevilla committing a foul barely half a minute into the match. Real Madrid responded with an indirect free-kick, only to commit a foul themselves shortly after, signaling that neither team was pulling their punches.

The opening exchanges were full of stoppages as the ball repeatedly went out of play. It took nearly seven minutes before any notable attempt on goal occurred. Real Madrid's direct free-kick culminated in a shot off-target, nudging the ball out for a throw-in. Sevilla, reshuffling their ranks after repeated skirmishes and fouls, were awarded a free-kick following a trip by Luka Modric on an opposition player. The play shifted momentarily in favor of Sevilla as they attempted to build momentum but encountered robust Real Madrid defending at every turn.

Around the 12th minute, we saw Samir Nasri’s pass for Sevilla failing to connect with his teammates, and a subsequent cross by Sergio Escudero was intercepted by the alert Real Madrid defense. The niggling fouls continued, with Cristiano Ronaldo seeing an offensive foul called against him after wriggling past an opponent.

Strategizing their way up the pitch, Real Madrid's best early attempt came in the 14th minute when Toni Kroos floated a corner into the box. The cross, however, was quickly intercepted. Real Madrid won another corner, only to witness a shot fly off-target. As the match progressed, both sides ventured forward, but resilience in defense remained a highlight for both teams. Sevilla's Nasri attempted crosses and shots multiple times, only to see his efforts thwarted by the Real defensive line and a vigilant Keylor Navas.

Rough tackling and fouls continued, with several stoppages. Iborra of Sevilla found himself in the referee’s book for a bad tackle, adding pressure on him to keep his composure for the rest of the match. Real Madrid had a promising chance around the 26th minute when Ronaldo's goal-bound effort from the edge of the box was superbly saved by Sergio Rico.

The half hovered on the precipice of breaking into life, marked by intermittent throws-in and clearances, with neither side capitalizing on their chances. Notably, Franco Vazquez and Samir Nasri remained persistent in their efforts for Sevilla, but the rock that was Real Madrid’s defense held firm. Ronaldo and his cohort, albeit menacing at times, tended to miss the crucial finish, like when Ronaldo narrowly struck wide upon picking up the ball inside the box close to the half-hour mark.

Sevilla, for their part, peppered the Real Madrid goal with mid-range attempts, notably Franco Vazquez’s attempt in the 31st minute, saved spectacularly by Navas. Both sides ended the half without tangible success in front of goal, hoping for a more decisive second half. Alejandro Hernandez’s whistle concluded a combative yet goalless first period, with both teams looking forward to enhancing their strategy during the break. The fans hoped for more sparks and less friction in the second half.

### Second Half:

The second half kicked off with Real Madrid taking the initial possession. Within moments, the ball was out of play, resulting in a throw-in for Sevilla. Victor Vitolo quickly made his presence felt, delivering a cross that won Sevilla a corner after a clearance. Nasri swung it short, but nothing came from the ensuing play. Sevilla’s persistence continued unabated, with Franco Vazquez’s strike from the edge of the penalty area being comfortably dealt with by Navas.

The game saw its first significant foul of the half when Marcelo committed a rough challenge, earning Sevilla a free kick, but Nasri's delivery resulted only in a clearance. Real Madrid tried to reorganize and push back but faced the same dogged tenacity in Sevilla's defense. Clearances and throw-ins peppered the midfield battle, with Marcelo sending a poorly hit strike way over the bar, highlighting Real's frustration.

Sevilla continued pressing and testing Real Madrid’s defense, but could only muster off-target shots. Notably, Ben Yedder’s solid attempt from inside the box at the 8th minute was saved by Navas, keeping the contest level. As the match approached the 20th-minute mark of the second half, a game-changing moment occurred. Marcelo's slight tackle inside the box on Sergio Rico caught referee Alejandro Hernandez's eye, leading to a penalty for Real Madrid. Amid the roars and sighs in the stadium, Cristiano Ronaldo stepped up and delivered a precise, low shot into the bottom left corner, putting Real Madrid ahead.

Sevilla’s response was quick, as they made substitutions to inject fresh legs into the fray, with Franco Vazquez giving way for Stevan Jovetic. This change aimed at revitalizing Sevilla's attacking intent. They continued exerting pressure with frenetic play, utilizing short corners and constantly seeking cracks in Real Madrid's defense.

As the clock continued ticking down, Real Madrid introduced Mateo Kovacic in place of Toni Kroos, hoping to bolster the midfield and control possession. However, an unfortunate own goal by Sergio Ramos changed the dynamic entirely. Off a whipped-in free kick, Ramos’ attempted clearance saw the ball find its way into his own net, much to the delight of the Sevilla supporters. The score was level at 1-1, setting up a tense finish.

Buoyed by the equalizer, Sevilla surged forward with renewed vigor. Samir Nasri’s cross into the box was met with a header but didn’t trouble Real’s defense significantly. Real Madrid, feeling the heat, had Marcelo booked for a harsh tackle, demonstrating the mounting pressure.

In a dramatic twist, Stevan Jovetic solidified Sevilla's dominance in the dying moments with a splendid long-range effort that sailed past Navas into the net, bringing the score to 2-1. The celebration was electric, reflecting the enormous significance the goal held.

Sevilla's tenacity paid off, their defense held firm against the late advances of Real Madrid. The final whistle brought an end to a pulsating match, with the home side claiming a memorable victory. The match will be remembered for its dramatic turn of events, tactical duels, and moments of individual brilliance. Both teams showcased their resolve, but it was Sevilla who emerged victorious, underlining their capability to challenge and unsettle the giants of La Liga.
